page.title: 01Rural Dorset-Isolated Beauty
page.content: This is an area of tiny hamlets and isolated farms nestling in the beautiful country side of the Bladmore Vale. The countryside i ery beautiful with small wooods dotted across the vale, crisscrossed by streams and rivers an the hills o Belchalwell and Okeford forming a backdrop in the south-east. The small hamlets are often very ancient settlement, and many o the building are old and picturesque. There has been very little recent building, not only rcause of lack of demand but also because of a conscious attempt on the part of the planning authorities to restrict evelopment. The majority of homes have cars ad need them, as the small villages and hamlets are isolated with few services. The farms hae a mixture of arable and grazing land producing both grain and
